author: agemanning
content: I liked the idea of keeping it there, just because we have the code, and makes it easier for new tools to connect to eth2 peers. But if it is somehow a security risk or we think it's best to remove redundant functionality, happy to remove. No strong opinions from us on this.

author: ajsutton
content: Teku doesn't mix and match snappy and non-snappy.  Either all rpc and gossip use snappy or none do.  That wasn't a particularly deliberate decision, just what was easier to implement and I don't see a lot of value in supporting both for RPC when gossip has to use one or the other exclusively.

author: arnetheduck
content: we support both through advertisement - there will be a slight simplification if we can support only one but both snappy and non-snappy are already on the critical path so it's not much different

author: arnetheduck
content: I'd probably remove it because supporting both, when writing a new client, is more work (ie with gossip being snappy-only, supporting non-snappy is an additional data pipeline variation) - that said, even if it's removed from the standard, we might keep supporting it out-of-band
